content.description: A number of variations exist to the left of Camp Mather. Pick your route according to the desired difficulty. An obvious variation is a lieback start followed by the face to the left of the broad arete once you have joined Camp Mather about half way up at the ledge.
content.protection: Two bolts on top for anchoring. Walk-off.

content.description: Face climb on handrails, crimps and knobs to the right edge of a small roof, clipping bolts as you go. Top out here or traverse left under the roof using a horizontal crack mostly hand and fist-sized.
content.protection: Build a top-rope anchor on a tree over the edge of the cliff or lead the route with 3 quick draws and singles in .3-4 for the roof traverse.
content.location: Walk up toward Inspiration Point at the H2 parking area and find a climber's trail left around the cliff edge. The route begins below two bolts with a handrail traversing up and left.

content.description: Start on the step and follow the easiest route up. This is well to the right hand side of the broad arete, and a few feet right of where your toprope will be hanging. This warmup route features jugs, mantels and crimps.
content.protection: 2 bolts on top for anchoring. Walk-off.
